abstract: Patrick Gottsch, the founder and president of RFD-TV, a cable channel that carries Don Imus’s show “but primarily chronicles life in rural America, said on Wednesday morning that he had signed an affiliation agreement with Comcast, the nation’s largest cable operator,” Jacques Steinberg reports.
lead_paragraph: Patrick Gottsch, the founder and president of RFD-TV, a cable channel that carries Don Imus’s show “but primarily chronicles life in rural America, said on Wednesday morning that he had signed an affiliation agreement with Comcast, the nation’s largest cable operator,” Jacques Steinberg reports.

headline.main: Imus Closer to a Return to TV

abstract: LAS VEGAS — Video on demand, as popularized by HBO and the major cable operators, doesn’t have the cachet of online video but is increasingly gaining viewers, said Matthew Strauss, the senior vice president for new media at Comcast Cable, at a panel discussion at the National Association of Television Program Executives conference on Tuesday.
lead_paragraph: LAS VEGAS — Video on demand, as popularized by HBO and the major cable operators, doesn’t have the cachet of online video but is increasingly gaining viewers, said Matthew Strauss, the senior vice president for new media at Comcast Cable, at a panel discussion at the National Association of Television Program Executives conference on Tuesday.

headline.main: Growing Demand for Video on Demand
